sequence.name: Windows 10, 11 and Server 2019, 2022
sequence.description: Default optimization template for Windows 10 (1809-21H2) and Windows 11 (21H2) or Server 2019 and Server 2022
sequence.author: VMware

changeLog.log: 1. Support Windows 10 LTSC 2019 (1809), Windows 10 1909/20H2/21H1/21H2, Windows 11 21H2 Windows Server 2016/2019/2022 2. Added support to more Office versions, including 2013/2016/2019/2021/365
1. Set start type of Windows Update service to be manual 2. Added a step to turn off notifications from apps and other senders
1. Set UBPM Autologger to be unselected by default 2. Remove Scheduled Task - TPM Maintenance

1. Moved default user optimizations to common options selection box. 2. Removed tweaks that where preferences. 3. Removed duplicate optimization. 4. Created Category Groups. 5. Renamed all optimizations to include action and type. 6. Removed power service tweak. 7. Removed tweaks that where equal to Windows default. 8. Set Windows Firewall and Antivirus tweaks to unselected by default.
1. Changed step Block all consumer Microsoft account user authentication to be unselected by default. 2. Changed the step Turn off Thumbnail Previews in File Explorer to be unselected by default.
Set several Hyper-V services be unselected by default
Recover removed items from respective templates of common options
1. Turn off account privacy notifications on Office 365 and Office 2019 2. Set Devices Platform Service to be unselected by default 3. Add new item to disable Search Roaming
Update execution condition of an item to be compatible with VMware Tools version 11 Remove an item, Group policy - Disable playing videos in web pages

1. Disable Passive Polling is no longer selected by default as this was shown to cause issues with some applications thinking they did not have internet connectivity. 2. Several items are updated to keep Cortana search and present search box as an icon on the taskbar.
Added an optimization item for using WDDM graphics display driver for Remote Desktop Connections

group.name: Modifications to Standard Image
group.description: Select "Disable" in the Options tab of any Task to bypass processing. Disable this entire section in the same manner.

step.name: Turn off handwriting personalization data sharing - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, Tablet PC users cannot choose to share writing samples from the handwriting recognition personalization tool with Microsoft.

step.name: Turn off handwriting recognition error reporting - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, users cannot start the handwriting recognition error reporting tool or send error reports to Microsoft.

step.name: Turn off the Windows Messenger Customer Experience Improvement Program - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, these tasks are removed from the File and Folder tasks in Windows folders.

step.name: Turn off Windows Customer Experience Improvement Program - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, all users are opted out of the Windows Customer Experience Improvement Program.

step.name: Turn off Windows Error Reporting - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, users are not given the option to report errors.

step.name: Windows should ask for my feedback - HKCU Registry
step.description: Never let windows ask for my feedback.

step.name: Turn Off Find My Device - Machine Policy
step.description: When Find My Device is off, the device and its location are not registered and the Find My Device feature will not work.

step.name: Disable Windows Error Reporting - Service
step.description: Error reporting services leveraged by Applications when they crash to send reports to Microsoft. If using DER within VDI consider alternate configuration.

group.name: On Screen Keyboard, Speech, Inking and Typing

step.name: Disable Language Components Installer Reconcile Language Resources - Scheduled Task
step.description: Disable Language Components Installer Reconcile Language Resources

step.name: Do not Allow Microsoft services to provide enhanced suggestions as the user types in the Address bar - Machine Policy
step.description: Disable this policy, users won't receive enhanced suggestions while typing in the Address bar. In addition, users won't be able to change the Suggestions setting on the Settings charm.

step.name: Disable SpeechModelDownloadTask - Scheduled Task

step.name: Don't allow Automatic Update of Speech Data - Machine Policy

step.description: Enable this policy, File Explorer does not create, read from, or write to thumbs.db files.

step.description: Force a specific default lock screen and logon image

step.description: Preventing Windows from keeping track of the apps that are used and searched most frequently

step.description: Change Video Playback Settings

step.name: Turn off Aero Shake window minimizing mouse gesture - User Policy

step.description: Set Windows Visual Effects to Optimized for balanced performance.

step.name: Turn off suggestions for all user-installed providers - Machine Policy
step.description: Turn off suggestions for all user-installed providers

step.name: Disable Internet Explorer Enhanced Security - HKLM Registry
step.description: Disable Internet Explorer Enhanced Security.

step.name: Disable IE Customization Wizard - Machine Policy
step.description: Removes the customization wizard upon first launch of Internet Explorer

step.name: Disable Background Synchronization - Machine Policy
step.description: Turn off background synchronization for feeds and Web Slices

step.name: Turn off the next pre-loaded page of a website - Machine Policy
step.description: Turn off the flip ahead with page prediction feature

step.name: Disable animations in web pages - Machine Policy
step.description: Only animated GIF files are affected by this setting

step.name: AutoRecover 2s delay - Machine Policy
step.description: Specify idle time to 2s before AutoRecover saved

step.name: Specify blank page for a new tab of IE - Machine Policy
step.description: Specify blank page as IE default behavior for a new tab

step.name: Turn off loading websites and content in the background - Machine Policy
step.description: IE doesn´t load any websites or content in the background, speeding up performance such that when the user clicks a hyperlink, the background page seamlessly switches into view.

step.name: Disable Periodic Check for Internet Explorer software updates - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, it prevents Internet Explorer from checking to see whether it is the latest available browser version and notifying users if a new version is available.

step.name: Disable showing the splash screen - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, the splash screen, which displays the program name, licensing, and copyright information, is not displayed.

step.name: Disable install new versions of Internet Explorer automatically - Machine Policy
step.description: Disable this policy, automatic upgrade of Internet Explorer will be turned off.

step.name: Prevent participation in the Customer Experience Improvement Program - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, the user cannot participate in the CEIP, and the Customer Feedback Options command does not appear on the Help menu.

step.name: Set tab process growth to low - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, set the rate at which Internet Explorer creates new tab processes to low.

step.name: Turn off Suggested Sites - Machine Policy
step.description: Disable this policy, the entry points and functionality associated with this feature are turned off.

step.name: Prevent automatic discovery of feeds and Web Slices - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, the user does not receive a notification on the toolbar that a feed or Web Slice is available.

step.description: Set home page to be blank for IE - Current User(1/2)

step.description: Enable this policy, any user on this computer is prevented from sharing digital media content from Windows Media Player with other computers and devices that are on the same network.

step.name: Do not send a Windows error report when a generic driver is installed on a device - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, an error report is not sent when a generic driver is installed.

step.name: Prevent creation of a system restore point during device activity that would normally prompt creation of a restore point - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, Windows does not create a system restore point when one would normally be created.

step.name: Prevent device metadata retrieval from the Internet - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, Windows does not retrieve device metadata for installed devices from the Internet.

step.name: Prevent Windows from sending an error report when a device driver requests additional software during installation - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this Policy, Windows does not send an error report to request additional software even if this is specified by the device driver.

step.name: Turn off "Found New Hardware" balloons during device installation - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, "Found New Hardware" balloons do not appear while a device is being installed.

step.name: Disable Payments and NFC/SE Manager - Service
step.description: Disable Payments and NFC/SE Manager Service

step.name: Use WDDM graphics display driver for Remote Desktop Connections - Machine Policy
step.description: This policy setting lets you enable WDDM graphics display driver for Remote Desktop Connections.

step.name: Disable USB Notifications - Scheduled Task
step.description: Disable Usb Notifications

step.name: Maximum size of Active Directory searches - User Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, set Number of objects returned to 5000.

step.name: Prevent the computer from joining a homegroup - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, users cannot add computers to a homegroup. This policy setting does not affect other network sharing features.

step.name: Turn off Automatic Download and Update of Map Data - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, the automatic download and update of map data is turned off.

step.name: Turn off unsolicited network traffic on the Offline Maps settings page - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, features that generate network traffic on the Offline Maps settings page are turned off. Note: This may turn off the entire settings page.

step.name: Don't allow Message Service Cloud Sync - Machine Policy
step.description: Don't allow backup and restore of cellular text messages to Microsoft´s cloud services.

step.name: Delivery Optimization downloads using HTTP only - Machine Policy
step.description: Delivery Optimization downloads using HTTP only

step.name: Turn off Event Viewer "Events.asp" links - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, event description hyperlinks are not activated and the text "More Information" is not displayed at the end of the description.

step.name: Turn off Help and Support Center "Did you know?" content - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, Help and Support Center no longer retrieves nor displays "Did you know?" content.

step.name: Turn off Help and Support Center Microsoft Knowledge Base search - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, it removes the Knowledge Base section from the Help and Support Center "Set search options" page, and only Help content on the local computer is searched.

step.name: Turn off Internet Connection Wizard if URL connection is referring to Microsoft.com - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, the "Choose a list of Internet Service Providers" path in the Internet Connection Wizard causes the wizard to exit. This prevents users from retrieving the list of ISPs, which resides on Microsoft servers.

step.name: Turn off Internet download for Web publishing and online ordering wizards - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, Windows does not download providers, and only the service providers that are cached in the local registry are displayed.

step.name: Turn off Internet File Association service - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, the link and the dialog for using the Web service to open an unhandled file association are removed.

step.name: Turn off Registration if URL connection is referring to Microsoft.com - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, it blocks users from connecting to Microsoft.com for online registration and users cannot register their copy of Windows online.

step.name: Turn off the "Order Prints" picture task - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, the task "Order Prints Online" is removed from Picture Tasks in File Explorer folders.

step.name: Turn off the "Publish to Web" task for files and folders - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, these tasks are removed from the File and Folder tasks in Windows folders.

step.name: Turn on BranchCache - Machine Policy
step.description: Disable this policy, turn off BranchCache for all client computers where the policy is applied.

step.name: Enable Hotspot Authentication - Machine Policy
step.description: Disable this policy, WLAN hotspots are not probed for WISPr protocol support, and users can only authenticate with WLAN hotspots using a web browser.

step.name: Turn off Microsoft Peer-to-Peer Networking Services - Machine Policy
step.description: Enable this policy, Turn off peer-to-peer protocols.

step.description: Disable BfeonServiceStartTypeChange

step.description: Disable Notification Task

step.description: Enable this policy, allow the user to restore the computer to the original state or from a user-created system image.

step.description: Disable reset base for DISM

step.name: Disable Boot Optimize Function - HKLM Registry
step.description: Disable windows automatically optimizes the file location for boot optimization.

step.name: Disable creation of Crash Dump - HKLM Registry
step.description: Removes the creation of a Crash Dump file

step.name: Increase Service Startup Timeout - HKLM Registry
step.description: Allows up to 120 seconds before timing out waiting for a service

step.name: Disable Reserved Storage - HKLM Registry
step.description: Disable Reserved Storage

step.name: Disable Storage Sense - Machine Policy
step.description: Disable Storage Sense.

step.name: Turn off System Restore - Machine Policy
step.description: System Restore is turned off, and the System Restore Wizard cannot be accessed.

step.name: Disable Reliability WMI Providers - Machine Policy
step.description: Disable this policy, Reliability Monitor will not display system reliability information, and WMI-capable applications will be unable to access reliability information from the listed providers.

step.name: Disable Windows Standby/Resume Performance Diagnostics - Machine Policy
step.description: Windows cannot detect, troubleshoot, and attempt to resolve automatically Windows Standby/Resume Performance Diagnostics problems that are handled by the DPS.

step.name: Configure Scenario Execution Level 1/6 - Machine Policy
step.description: Disable this policy, Windows will not be able to detect, troubleshoot or resolve any Windows Resource Exhaustion problems that are handled by the DPS.

step.name: Configure Scenario Execution Level 2/6 - Machine Policy
step.description: Disable this policy, Windows will not be able to detect, troubleshoot or resolve any Windows Shutdown Performance problems that are handled by the DPS.

step.name: Configure Scenario Execution Level 3/6 - Machine Policy
step.description: Disable this policy, Windows will not be able to detect, troubleshoot or resolve any Windows Standby/Resume Performance problems that are handled by the DPS.

step.name: Lower Scenario Execution Level 5/6 - Machine Policy
step.description: Windows cannot detect, troubleshoot, and attempt to resolve automatically any heap corruption problems that are handled by the DPS.

step.name: Configure Scenario Execution Level 6/6 - Machine Policy
step.description: Disable this policy, the DPS is not able to diagnose memory leak problems.

step.name: Configure Scenario Execution Level - Machine Policy
step.description: Disable this policy, Windows will not be able to detect, troubleshoot or resolve any Windows Boot Performance problems that are handled by the DPS.

step.name: Disable Windows Boot Performance Diagnostics(1/2) - Machine Policy
step.description: Windows cannot detect, troubleshoot, and attempt to resolve automatically Windows Boot Performance Diagnostics problems that are handled by the DPS.

step.name: Disable Windows Boot Performance Diagnostics(2/2) - Machine Policy
step.description: Windows cannot detect, troubleshoot, and attempt to resolve automatically Windows Boot Performance Diagnostics problems that are handled by the DPS.

step.name: Disable Scheduled Maintenance Diagnostics - Machine Policy
step.description: Disable this policy, Windows will not be able to detect, troubleshoot or resolve problems on a scheduled basis.

step.name: Disable scheduled diagnostics - Machine Policy
step.description: Windows will not be able to detect, troubleshoot or resolve problems on a scheduled basis.

step.description: Disable WDI - ResolutionHost
